assertive_deadclose: [t_c paces back and forth in front of the warrior's den, muttering to themselves and flexing their claws.]
They're gone, they're gone, they're gone ...
... Hey, what are you looking at, huh?
I don't have to take this fox-dung from you! Leave! Go find someone else to gawk at!
[As you leave, you hear t_c resume their muttering.]
assertive_deadclose1: You can talk to StarClan cats, right?
Have you, uh ... heard anything from d_c?
Sorry. That's probably a mouse-brained question. I know it doesn't work like that.
But, if you ever do hear from them ... tell them that, uh ...
I'm sorry. And I'll keep their nest warm. And they better be saving a spot for me up in StarClan, or else I'll have to come up there myself and teach them a lesson!
assertive_deadclose3: ... I can't believe d_c is really gone ...
I was supposed to keep them safe, I ...
I failed them. Don't even try to talk me out of it. I know I failed them.
I need to go on a walk. Clear my head.
Don't follow after me, either, y_c, I ... I need to be alone.
assertive_deadclose5: It's clear out tonight ... lotta stars up there, huh?
D'you ... d'you think d_c might be up there?
I know it's mouse-brained, but ... sometimes, I can still feel them right next to me.
Which star do you think d_c is?
I think it's that one, over there. The brightest star in the whole sky.
assertive_deadclose6: Uh ... hey, y_c ... How's it going ...
I'm, uh ... I'm not, uh ... I ...
[t_c suddenly collapses into you, sobbing into your fur.]
I just miss d_c so much ...
assertive_deadclose_2: [You hear quiet sobbing coming from t_c's nest.]
Yes, I'm okay! I'm perfectly fine! Now leave, before I rake you a big, ugly scar!
assertivekitten_deadclose_5: Hmph. Everyone always tells me they're sorry, just so sorry for my loss. Next time someone says that to me, I'll claw their throat out.
I don't need anybody's pity, can't they see that?
... Honestly, I'm not really sure what I need.
I think I just need to hear d_c's laugh again.
assertivekitten_deadclose_6: I'm strong. I can handle this, I - I should be able to handle this.
So why does it hurt so much?
Who knew that the worst pain I'd ever feel would be inflicted by d_c.
assertive_yougrief1: [When you ask t_c what happened to d_c, and if you'll ever see them again, something on their face breaks.]
Ah ... Ah, kid, I'm so sorry ...
It ain't right, what happened to d_c ...
But, mark my words, you haven't seen the last of them. Though, it may be a while. They're up in StarClan now, with our warrior ancestors.
One day, you'll reunite again. But until then, just know they're up there watching over you, helping you grow strong and healthy.
Can you try to grow up strong and healthy for them?
assertive_yougrief2: Hey, uh ... I'll say an extra prayer for d_c tonight.
Try to take it easy, m'kay? They wouldn't want their death to keep you from living.
I'll bring you back some prey later from the hunting patrol.
assertive_yougrief3: I'm so sorry for your loss, y_c ...
d_c was a really special cat.
assertive_jealous1: You and d_c were close, right? Man, it's so terrible ...
This is why c_nClan needs better defenses. To keep anything like this from happening again.
assertive_jealous1_4: It wasn't your fault, y_c. You know that, don't you?
Dwelling on it won't make it any better.
No matter how hard you try, your guilt won't bring d_c back. They wouldn't want this to keep you from living.
